elements.description:
`<color-selector>` adds a color selector to your page using Polymer.

  ```html
    <color-selector value="{{color}}"></color-selector>
  ```

For example if you clamp on `hours`, you can round `color` and `value` to `00:00:00`. If you set `clamp="day"` you hide the day-selection.

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--color-picker-margin` | margin of the single color-picker | `0px`
`--color-picker-background` | background-color of the color-picker | `#f0f0f0`

properties.name: showCurrentSelectedColor
properties.description: show the color field of the current selected color

params.name: hsv
params.description: The value of the color of the current view.

elements.name: ColorSelector

attributes.name: show-current-selected-color
attributes.description: show the color field of the current selected color

  ```html
    <color-selector value="{{color}}"></color-selector>
  ```

For example if you clamp on `hours`, you can round `color` and `value` to `00:00:00`. If you set `clamp="day"` you hide the day-selection.

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default

elements.description:
`color-picker` is a picker for color for **[Polymer](https://github.com/Polymer/polymer)** that can use the native input, too. If the **native** picker is choosen and is not supported, this element uses the **polyfill** datetime-picker. The `<calendar-element>` and the `<time-element>` will come in place if the native picker is not available or is not explicitly wanted. The `value` represents the selected `hex-color` and `alpha` the opacity of the color. `css-value` will give you directly the css-string.

 ```html
   <color-picker value="{{value}}"></color-picker>
 ```

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--input-margin` | margin of the single color-picker | `0px`
`--input-background` | background-color of the color-picker | `#f0f0f0`
`--input-color` | color of the color-picker | `#f0f0f0`

properties.name: showCurrentSelectedColor
properties.description: show the color field of the current selected color

properties.name: native
properties.description: use the native input, if it exists

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "left", "right", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: autoConfirm
properties.description: Set to true to make the input auto-confirming

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

params.name: hsv
params.description: The value of the color of the current view.

elements.description:
`<overlay-color-picker>` extends `color-picker` in an overlay.

 ```html
   <overlay-color-picker value="{{value}}"></overlay-color-picker>
 ```

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--color-picker-margin` | margin of the single color-picker | `0px`
`--color-picker-background` | background-color of the color-picker | `#f0f0f0`
   *

properties.name: alwaysOnTop
properties.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

properties.name: noOverlap
properties.description: Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as preferred alignment
and if there's not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

properties.name: showCurrentSelectedColor
properties.description: show the color field of the current selected color

properties.name: native
properties.description: use the native input, if it exists

properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: autoConfirm
properties.description: Set to true to make the input auto-confirming

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

params.name: hsv
params.description: The value of the color of the current view.
